values:
When in a relationship, don't be whiny.  It's annoying and unattractive.  Their boyfriends must be getting some intense benefits to deal with this...I'm this close to asking them if they would like some cheese to go with it!

Oh, and my sweet, sweet, motivation....where for art thou?  In all seriousness--I have a shit ton of things to get done, deadlines to meet, and adult responsibilities to resume, and yet no desire to do any of them.  Please let me find my driving force soon.  Throwing myself into my work would definitely be a decent distraction right about now.
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/67006.html

I've been waiting to watch John Mayer on Storytellers all week.  I've heard he's an asshole and that may or may not be true but that doesn't change the fact that I love his music.  It means so much more when an artist has taken the time to write their own songs...you can honestly tell, you can feel that they've put a part of themselves into it.  And some days, even after listening to a song hundreds of times, you wake up and listen to that same song and it suddenly makes sense.  Or maybe it just makes sense in a way you never thought it would.

Anyway, before playing Who Says, Mayer discusses his reasoning behind the song.  How the song is standing up to all of the bullies in the world and the inner bullies too.  The fact of the matter is, I need to stop caring so much about what people think or feel about me.  Granted there are times when I should be aware of how my words/actions affect those around me, but when it comes to me just being me, being true to myself, I shouldn't give a shit. I can't make everyone happy 100% of the time. Who Says I can't be me.
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/66572.html

I'm not going to completely close this chapter of my life; hell, we barely got to the good part.  It seems like the characters were just introduced and that endless possibilities are sure to follow.  I'm worried that he's already a workaholic though.  The fact that he's driven and working his ass off to get where he wants to be is fantastic, but it also freaks me out in that I fear that maybe he never will have/make the time for me.  And if  that's the case--I need to cut the cord before it's too late.

If it doesn't work out, I'll keep my chin up.  My career is a priority too but unless I have someone to share it with it doesn't seem as important.
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/66542.html

Who ever said you can't run away from your problems was seriously misinformed.  Things with the guys definitely hit the fan today.  I was truly hurt and upset with a friend I've had for seventeen years.  I blew up and expressed my feelings to both of them--I'm pretty sure that one of them understood where I was coming from and apologized but the one that I've known forever, who I care so much for, really didn't get it.  He's still too concerned about being a people-pleaser and spreading himself as thin as humanly possible.  I guess now I have to accept the fact that this is how it's going to be.  I obviously can't change who he is.

Right now I wish that I could go on a mini vacation.  I wish that I could put everything on hold, freeze time if you will (oh, I will), and escape to another place.  I feel that my mind and heart/emotions are entitled to some time away from here.  I'm sick of the lack of communication that my group of friends is exhibiting.  The lack of love and respect for one another.  It's really sad, and it hurts to see it happen.  I don't want to burn bridges with the friends that I've made.

When relaying all of tonight's events with my one roommate, I got the feeling that she thought I was being selfish.  I could see it all over her face.  I really hope that's not the case and now I can't stop thinking about it.  The fact of that matter is; I don't feel that the situation is fair.  Nobody should be putting the effort into a friendship to have it all blow-up in their face.  I need to just let this whole thing go.  What's done is done.  I'm glad I finally spoke my peace.
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/66287.html

I fear that our group of friends is about to "go on a break." 

I don't know when or how it happened, but something tells me that if there weren't couples this wouldn't be happening.  There is just so much drama, bull shit, and people putting their noses in each other's business.  I miss last year.  I miss the guys being right downstairs, drinking spontaneously, watching movies at 3 am and playing football.  Steph was definitely right when she said that everything was changing and it would never go back to that again.  Most of the time I'm completely okay with growing up, in fact I usually I support it... But when crap like this happens, with people growing apart and treating each other like dirt for no apparent reason, I despise it!  I hate feeling like a stranger in my own home or around my friends.  It seems like only the couples can hang out with each other and the rest of us are the odd ones out.  The holiday season is supposed to bring about togetherness, I hope it happens.  I already miss him and to feel like my friends are in their own little world makes the loneliness even harder.  I think spending time at home with my family is necessary--I need to get away from here before the shit hits the fan! 

Oh, and if you're wondering...it's not you, it's me.
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/65919.html

Time is literally flying by this school year.  I can't believe I'm only a year and a half away from being pushed out of the nest and soaring into the real world.  School is going really well--I can't wait to put everything I'm learning into practice.  To recap (for my future self):
-Spending time in Venice for Thanksgiving was actually really nice.  I didn't have any distractions and got to spend a good amount of time catching up with my family.  It's nice coming home not as often--makes you appreciate it a lot more.  Venice is Venice, but Orlando is definitely becoming the place that I want to live after graduation.
-The family is good---mom and her beau are doing well...I suppose.  I've gotten more use to him being around but I honestly don't have a lot to say to him.  I get along with him and all--and mom seems happy, so that's what truly matters.  I'm glad that he's not mooching off of her, like I was fearing, and that they've worked out some sort of billing situation. :)  Having said this, I'm still not a big fan of the macho man that he tries to be.  He's apparently been everywhere and done everything and has no problem telling you about it...gag.
-Boys....they're "special"...I think that's the nicest way of putting it.  I've decided that the one I have/had tends to be incredibly one track minded and has difficulties balancing different aspects of his life.  Our "relationship" has becoming another "responsibility" for him--one he can't handle at the moment. He was constantly feeling guilty for his lack of availability, which in turn made me feel guilty.  He needs to focus on his career right now, and for that I say "more power to ya!"  It hurts, I'm not gonna sugar coat it.  He is by far one of the sweetest and most respectful men I've dated.  He makes me laugh and makes me want to be a better person when he's around.  He himself has said that we've already created a strong foundation of a friendship.  Unfortunately, a relationship is just not in the cards right now.  Part of me feels like a weight has been lifted--I was so busy being the eternal optimist.  But at the same time, I miss him.  And I'm so afraid that if I tell him that he'll think I'm holding onto something that I shouldn't and he'll push himself away.

Either way, life is pretty great right now.  Good friends, good family, good environment.  I'm thankful for what I've had and what I have at this moment.  It's amazing how the tiniest events all add up to make a bigger picture--I think I'm beginning to cherish the little things; the moments with the people that I care about and who care about me in return.<br type="_moz" />
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/65686.html

Many a decision has been made since my last update.  School is going really well—I’m thrilled to have the professors that I do.  Either we are learning actual practices that we will use in the classroom or we are having detailed discussions with our peers.  Both make me feel a little more prepared for my graduation in a year and a half…*gulp* scary huh?

 

Living arrangements are weird—it’s mainly Steph and I by ourselves, which is fine with us.  The other two spend an incredible amount of time with their boyfriends, it’s almost like they can’t live without each other.  My one roommate and I got into a brawl last week, minus the whole throwing punches/hair pulling thing.  We have really similar dispositions, aka we both hate confrontation, which leads to either peace and harmony or the apocalypse.  We had it out, expressed our feelings, but I still don’t know if she understood where I was coming from.  I’m starting to realize the differences in how we were all brought up.  Obviously we’re all friends, but I’m getting to the point where I don’t want to necessarily help people who are in my major with me.  I don’t understand what’s so difficult about staying on top of your work and listening to the teacher about what/when things are due.  I guess it’s my dog-eat-dog, take care of me and get my stuff done attitude that’s starting to show through—I never really realized that I had that in me.

 

When it comes to my impending career, my attitude towards it is a complete 180 from last semester.  In the spring I was freaking out about whether or not this was even for me because the Martha Stewarts in the ed department had completely overshadowed the work I’d done.  Now, it’s a different story.  I’m working with the JA program and am in the classroom once a week, with a lovely group of second graders.  I’d never thought I’d like teaching this age group to be honest.   I’m having a great time with them.  After my first lesson I had this moment of clarity.  I received such positive feedback from the students and teacher that it really raised my confidence.  I’ve obviously taught students in the field of the performing arts but seeing that I was able to be just as affective with an academic subject made me realized that this is what I want to do.  It was such a high—a rush similar to performing for me—and let me tell you, improve skills definitely come in handy!

 

The other decision I’ve made is regarding those friends of ours from Mars, and I’m not talking about aliens here.  I don’t know why I was even considering someone else—wait, yes I do.  It all came down to convenience.  His availability was what the other was lacking and for some awful reason I was seriously willing to risk our friendship to make it work.  I don’t know what the hell I was thinking.  An act of desperation I suppose.  Seeing everyone else happy in relationships does that to you.  If I was in a cartoon, this would be the moment where an anvil with ACME written on it would fall on my head.  Anyway, after not seeing each other for about a month we met up on Monday.  I grew a pair and finally expressed the feelings/concerns/things I wanted to talk about with him.  I was so nervous the last time we tried to do this, I don’t know why since I can literally talk about anything with him.  Yes, this dating thing of ours is progressing slowly but I’m really happy that it’s like that.  Together we have already built a really strong friendship, a fantastic building block that a lot of relationships lack.  We both know that we are interested in each other as more than that but we want to just take it one step at a time, live in the moment instead of rushing the future.  There’s just this different feeling I experience with him, an ‘x’ factor if you will.  He makes me happy and that is the most important thing.  We could go anywhere or do anything and I know that we would still have a fabulous time because we’re with each other.
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/65349.html
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/65217.html

Like most people I know, I have definitely neglected livejournal this summer.  I've kept myself busy:  trip to NYC, teaching children (of the corn) at two different locations, spending nights either at the beach, pool, or watching movies courtesy  of Netflix...Soon Amber will be living with me and then before we know it we'll be back in Whorelando in our new big girl apartment.  Seriously though, August 10th can't come soon enough.

There have already been some speed bumps this summer.  Nothing too severe---I caused most of them and have either slapped myself for creating the situations in the first place or yelled at myself for getting involved with things that are none of my business.  I hate the fact that I usually feel like I'm on the road to being a responsible adult and then I relapse and go and do something that inevitably hurts myself and someone else who I care about.

Other than minor missteps along the way---summer has been relaxing and eye opening.  Mom has made it clear to me that she is completely okay with me never returning to Venice to live, and I'm okay with that too.  For some reason I think I'll end up living in a state I never thought I'd reside in.  I'm just going to go wherever I'm needed and where I feel happy.  As I was cleaning the other day I opened my senior year book just to look back at how things have already changed only 2 years after graduation.  There's a page where myself and several of my friends are quoted with where we think we'll be in 10 years.  One of my closest friends said that he'd "be back at  Venice teaching at the high school."  If you asked him the same question today I'm sure that Venice wouldn't even be in the top 10 places he wants to end up.  It blows my mind how one life choice (in this case going to college) can completely alter where your life goes.  The people you meet, the places you go, the things you experience gradually steer your life in a new direction.  And I can confidently say that I am 100% okay with that.

As far as guy world is concerned, no one here has captured my attention, and part of that is because I don't want them to.  I've kept in contact with the guy I met in Orlando.  He really wants to come down and visit but right now he's back home visiting his family so I'm not too worried about it.  This is the first time that I'm not over analyzing and freaking out over a guy and how I can't control the situation.  I miss him, of course I do, but I want this to just run its course.  I like him and he likes me.  If our bond is strong enough we'll make it work.  Now that he's graduated there's no way of knowing where his job will take him--I've already made it clear that I'm not going to beg him to stay in Orlando, even though the selfish part of me who really cares about him wants him to.  Deep down, it feels right, and I just hope that we get some sort of chance to see if this could be something great.

Sometimes it's nice not knowing what's around the bend...
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/64880.html

It's amazing to me how in only a year a spark that was between two people can completely vanish.  You run into that person again and you stop and wonder how it even began in the first place.  How there was once this fire and now there is absolutely nothing.  You see them, you hear them partake in conversation and you wonder how the two of you were together.  Maybe people just become who you want them to be in that instant that you need them.  In that moment they appeared practically perfect--you had so much in common, you were 100% attracted to them, and it worked.  Now,  6 months later or even a year later, that flame has all but disappeared.  You see them as someone else, not necessarily in a bad way, they are just simply not what you want anymore.  Perhaps I've changed in this short time.  Perhaps they've changed.  Perhaps it's the fact that I've met someone else and now they're no longer the perfect fit.  Humans may be creatures of habit, but there is no doubt in my mind that we are also creatures of change.
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/64763.html

is in fact a virtue.  One I'm begging to have.  I like him, I really do.  The feeling is mutual.  Getting to see him, however, is another story entirely.  He's super busy with school and video shoots---I don't want to be the selfish one who begs him to spend time with me instead of furthering his career.  That simply isn't going to happen.  The worst part is, it looks as if I'm not even going to get to say goodbye.  He says he'll drag his ass to Sarasota--I would take 5 minutes with him right now.  I can tell that this whole waiting thing is going to be a challenge.  The question is, am I up for it?
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/64472.html

Dear Over-Analytical Brain,
I think I may have found a keeper.  Please don't screw this up
xoxo-T
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/64001.html

where this 'Hart' isn't.

When people ask me where I'd want to live after graduation I'd always include Venice in the list of possibilities.  After this trip I'm not so sure.  I'd always say that the two reasons behind that decision were 1) my family and 2) the theatre.  Well, the grandparents are my grandparents.  I love them and their craziness, but mainly in small amounts.  The madre, she's got her beau and that's just fine, it's just weird not having Mother-Daughter hang-out time like we used to.  And honestly, with how stressed work as her--I don't want to spend a whole hell of a lot of my free time with her. On to VT...to quote White Christmas, "the theatre, the theatre...what's happened to the theatre?"  Frankly, it starting to drain the life out of me.  I love the people, I really do, but there is so much bullshit and drama that it's almost suffocating.  I've officially realized that my life is in Orlando.  It's a scary thought, but it's where a lot of my friends are, where my work and play are...it's hard to leave the people I really love behind in Venice.  I wish I could shrink them to Mike TV size and take pocket-sized versions of them with me, but they too will soon be moving on to bigger and better things.  Such is life.

Growing up is such a strange feeling. 

Starting a new chapter is scary when you don't know how it ends.

*side note:  a romantic interest would be great in this autobiography right now! ;) just sayin'!
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/63977.html

One thing about him is he never mixes his groups of friends.  He'll hang with us and then 10 minutes later he's saying "see ya" as he heads out the door towards the next round of drinks.  For some reason, hell froze over last night--I got to go out with him.  To say I had a great time would be an understatement. Great people. Great atmosphere.  This weekend has been somewhat of a vicious circle--but at this point, I figure I have to live my life one way or the other. 

Even if nothing ever comes of it, us being together that is, he's teaching me to just chill. To enjoy the life you have and truly live it.  To not freak out over the things you can't control, but make the best of the situation.  My OCD seriously needs that.  It needs to be slapped in the face every once and a while and told to "snap out of it."

It seems V-Day wasn't about the love you have for your significant other this year.  It was about a love for life, and a love for the friends who make it that much more special.


*brought to you by Quarters and Fuck the Dealer
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/63601.html

I thought this cowboy was long gone.
That he had ridden off into the west.
Apparently, I was wrong.
I just can't believe that he finally contacted me first.
That I wasn't the one trying to resurrect something that was clearly 6 feet under.
I'm just glad that we can finally be friends.
It almost makes him seem like a little less of an asshole....
Almost.
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/63335.html

Is this a reoccurring theme?  
Me. 
Him.
Running errands.
Reading in his living room.
I in the chair. 
Him on the futon.
He glances at me when I read aloud.
I feel his eyes, and begin to wish...
Wish that I knew how he felt.
Maybe his feelings have changed since that October night.
Maybe they haven't.
Maybe I should let go.
If only his grip on me wasn't so tight.
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/63120.html

Tonight was fantastic.
It was just the two of us.
Us.
Reading.
Laughing.
Enjoying each others company.
Comfortable on his apartment's love seat.
Feeling like we were actually a couple.

But then I had to walk upstairs.

Forcing myself to wake up.
Back to reality.
Where I'm alone, and he's impossible to read.
Thinking.
Wishing.
Me.
Tonight was fantastic.
It was just the two of us.
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/62841.html

You know that feeling when you look at a picture of yourself and you pause for a minute and say...."god, who is that person?" That's how I feel right now.  I don't like the way I look, or feel...I guess being home by myself doesn't help much either. I hate not being truly happy.  Sure, there are moments with my friends that I'm having a good time, but I miss that giddy sense of happy.  When you feel like you're going to pop...you're so happy that absolutely nothing can bring you back down to reality...It's hard living in an apartment where it's like the damn Newlywed game 24/7.  I need to stop being an emotional train wreck. Choo. Choo.
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/62695.html

So...this weekend is a no go.  I'm officially in the "friends category" once again.  I should have told him how I felt in our therapy session last night...this is ridiculous.  I'm definitely not the sharpest tool in the shed...
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/62221.html

We had a real conversation that lasted a few hours tonight.  It wasn't him being a psychology major for once--it was just us, two people, giving and taking, sharing stories, laughing.  He's an awesome friend, and I realized that having him as just that isn't a terrible thing.  Something fresh is going to start this weekend with someone who has been in my life for a long time.  I'm excited to see if it is anything at all--it's a good distraction, and believe it or not, I've gotten butterflies from him just calling me.  That's something my therapy session of a friend never gave me.  With him, I'm afraid that I tried too damn hard from the beginning.  I may not have even been myself until it was too late.  I can't wait to see what this weekend will bring.
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/62127.html

He had a fight with his roommate so he came up stairs.  They weren't kidding when they said that alcohol makes you tell the truth.  Turns out that when I had a crush on him a year ago, he liked me too.  We talked for a long time and finally truly bonded.  Then my roommate came home, tipsy would be putting it lightly.  By the end of the night, they were kissing--did I mention I was right next to them?  How can you go from finally telling someone how you felt so long ago, to kissing a person you barely even know?  Shitty---that's what this situation is.  It's a shame she's so drunk that she'll never think she hurt my feelings in the morning.
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/61775.html

"When the rain
Is blowing in your face
And the whole world
Is on your case
I could offer you
A warm embrace
To make you feel my love

When the evening shadows
And the stars appear
And there is no one there
To dry your tears
I could hold you
For a million years
To make you feel my love

I know you
Haven't made
Your mind up yet
But I would never
Do you wrong
I've known it
From the moment
That we met
No doubt in my mind
Where you belong

I'd go hungry
I'd go black and blue
I'd go crawling
Down the avenue
No, there's nothing
That I wouldn't do
To make you feel my love

The storms are raging
On the rolling sea
And on the highway of regret
Though winds of change
Are throwing wild and free
You ain't seen nothing
Like me yet

I could make you happy
Make your dreams come true
Nothing that I wouldn't do
Go to the ends
Of the Earth for you
To make you feel my love"

I've cared about him since August--hell, since I met him last year...all that time has passed and I've still done nothing about it.  It doesn't help when your good friend consistently reminds you that he only sees you as a friend, or that he's "just a nice guy," or happens to mention how sweet and attractive he is...all...the...time!  I wish I could just wake up tomorrow and all my questions would be answered.   The confusion would end, this awful fog would lift, and I would just magically be with him...but it's not that easy.  Nothing ever is.  I just wish it would change.  I need the courage to make it happen for myself, because I don't want to live with the regret...
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/61649.html

What an insane year it was, not to sound cliche but it definitely was a roller coaster.  The highs were wonderful: I made friendships stronger, found out what it was like to love someone, actually LIVED at college, and laughed more this year than I have in a while.  And with those highs came some lows...even though they were tough to get through, they have changed me for the better and I am thankful for that.

The only thing I what to change in 2009 is to have more guts.  I am going to live this year---do the things I want to do wholeheartedly.  Whatever this situation I do not want to stop and worry about what other people will say or think--I just want to do.  Hopefully, it will be worth it, and I will only continue to grow...

Happy New Year!  Make it count! Live, Laugh, Love....and Just Be!
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/61225.html

I've come to the conclusion that I'm Nobody's girl.

I've been a friend, and only ever a friend.
I've been one of the guys.
I've been loved too quickly, that I ran away scared.
I've been a showmance.
I've been a convenience.
 

I long for  Nobody so that I can finally be Somebody to love.
Thanks Queen.

*Sorry if you're sick of these love filled posts, but this is my place to vent.
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/60594.html

I like him.  There's no hiding it.  Unfortunately, I can't find the strength to tell him how I feel.  I'm scared he won't return the feelings.  I'm scared it will end up making our friendship awkward.  Mostly, I'm scared of what will happen if I don't tell him.  One day at a time.  I just wish he wasn't so difficult to read--then maybe, just maybe I wouldn't be quite so worried about opening my mouth and letting the truth slip out.
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/60180.html

I've been in denial.
I've been depressed,
I've been angry as hell.
I've bargained.
And yesterday I tried incredibly hard to get the attention of someone I don't even like that much.
I want to move on and forget more than anything, but finding the strength isn't easy.

I'm lonely, and I absolutely hate it.

Why is it that women seemed to be programmed with a ticking clock inside of them?  Even though I'm not even 20 yet I feel like I can hear each second go by as it echoes and radiates through my body.  Maybe I'm not meant to be married or have kids.  Maybe it's just not "in the cards" for me.  I feel like so many things in my life have gone right, and for that I'm grateful, but love seems to be the one thing I constantly fuck up.

I need to throw myself into my work.  Throw myself into my friends and stop thinking about "needing" to be with a man.  No matter how hard that task may be.

The last couple of months have been filled with bad choices.  I've hurt myself and I've hurt other people whom I care about very much.  For that, I am truly sorry.

xoxo-"I am a lone reed."
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/60123.html

I hate to say it but the Cheers theme song had it backwards.  Sometimes you want to go where no body knows your name.

I want to start over.  I feel pretty pathetic right now, and I'm not a big fan of feeling that way.

I thought I grew up this summer.  In reality it wasn't what I did over the summer that made me grow up, it's dealing with the aftermath now.  

Evaluating the choices I made and deciding how they will change me as a person--that's growing up.
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/59661.html

I left a message--the last one I will ever leave.
I spoke my mind.
I deserve better.
I don't deserve to be fucked with like this.
If he doesn't want me around, I want to move on.
Living for today is better than living in the past.

Somewhere is someone for me.
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/59492.html

"so fuck you
and your untouchable face
and fuck you
for existing in the first place
and who am i
that i should be vying for your touch
and who am i
i bet you can't even tell me that much"


i was done with him--or at least close to being done. then for some god-awful reason i send him a text...he responds immediately after not saying a word to me in weeks. he then asks if i'm going to see his show...i wish i could read his mind so i could figure out if he's right there with me or if we truly are in two different places. i don't want to be an asshole--i want to keep being his friend and see his show, but at the same time, in order to no longer think of him romantically, i think i need to cut him out for awhile....ugh....i need guidance.

rock. me. hard-place.
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/59294.html

I'm done with him.  He treated me like shit after I left for college.  I wanted to remain friends but it doesn't seem like that is going to happen.  It was what it was, nothing more, nothing less.  If he needs me for anything, he knows where he can find me.  I'm done thinking about him, and what could have been.  It's clearly not worth my time or energy.  I just hope that there's a light at the end of the tunnel--that there's someone around the bend who will help heal the hole he left. 

I am ready to move on.  To truly laugh again and share things with someone else.  To love like I almost did.
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/59061.html

I can't take it anymore.  I am sick and tired of thinking about him--thinking about how badly I want him and how I probably never will again.  There's nothing worse than having something wonderful in your life and then having it taken away just as quickly as it came.  I need it.  I want it.  I feel empty and lonely and I hate it.  He made me happy.
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/58784.html

Within the last 3 days two people I knew have died.  I can't believe that tonight I was talking to my roommates about the pain of having people I care about be 2 hours away when so many now have to deal with people they love being taken from them completely.  I don't want to miss him anymore.  He told me to never cry in front of him or about him and now it's impossible for one tear to fall down my face.  I shouldn't be concentrating on this stupid situation I can't control.  I need to be living, loving the people I am around, and working towards my future.  Clearly life is too short and I am spending too long a time on a man who isn't even here.

So I'm currently enjoying my annual watching of every episode of The West Wing.  I love the show, it doesn't bore  me in the slightest, but when I am very tired the rhythmic line deliveries often lull me to sleep.  This afternoon that exact thing happened.  Before I knew it I was on an episode, sitting on a bus in between Allison Janney and Bradley Whitford.  We must have been in between takes because I start telling both of them the reasons why I love the show so much.  Suddenly, Bradley gets up to make some sort of announcement over the bus intercom and I look Allison right in the eye and say to her, "Thank you for doing what you do because I didn't have the courage to do it."

Yeah, I'll readily admit that it's pretty disgusting that I feel like I know these characters, that I feel so involved in their world.  In the end, I simply appreciate what they do as actors, and what Aaron Sorkin has done as a writer and director.  Unfortunately, it seems that sometimes I wish their world was the one I was a part of.
http://beyondthepaint.livejournal.com/57987.html

I don't remember ever feeling so empty--to the point where it simply hurts to function.  All I've done lately is stay in bed, in my pjs, watching The West Wing, and sleeping far more than I should. I just want the ache to go away.

Today was shitty--I don't want to sugar coat it.  It hurts when on the same day one of your closest friends and the guy you are seeing decide that "the best thing" is that you call it quits.  I can't believe how much the two of them think the same.  They both wanted to end things on an amazing note and then walk away.  Walk away as if there is no pain or suffering--make the cut a clean one.  What I don't understand is that if the time spent together is so wonderful--why end a good thing?
     I don't want to lose either one.  The conversations I've had with both of them today have left me with a sick feeling in my stomach.  I want to completely purge and let every once of poison out of my body that they have left behind.  It appears that I deserve this--I caused at least one person extreme heartache earlier this summer--it's only right that I too walk away a little bit bruised.
     The silver lining is that I get to leave in a week.  I'm the one who gets to run away.  I just wish that the people I have developed amazing relationships with this summer could be shrunk and packed away with my office supplies, clothes, and books.

"Everybody needs a little time away," I heard her say, "from each
other."
"Even lover's need a holiday far away from each other."
Hold me now.
It's hard for me to say I'm sorry.
I just want you to stay.

After all that we've been through,
I will make it up to you. I promise to.
And after all that's been said and done,
You're just the part of me I can't let go.

Couldn't stand to be kept away just for the day from your body.
Wouldn't wanna be swept away, far away from the one that I love.
Hold me now.
It's hard for me to say I'm sorry.
I just want you to know.
Hold me now.
I really want to tell you I'm sorry.
I could never let you go.

After all that we've been through,
I will make it up to you. I promise to.
And after all that's been said and done,
You're just the part of me I can't let go.

After all that we've been through,
I will make it up to you. I promise to.

You're gonna be the lucky one.

Writing at 2am is never a good idea, I suppose.  I want to address my last post and make sure that if I hurt anyone's feelings, that was not my intention.  I realize that my actions from a few days ago were not the best.  But I still stand by the choice I made.  Had the circumstances been different, had I been by myself and not had someone else is tow--you know who I would have chosen to spend my time with.  I know I hurt you, and I understand where you are coming from.  I just hope that you can forgive me for this minor lapse in judgment.  Hurting the people I love is the last thing I would want to do.

Have I ever mentioned how much I hate it?  Not like the good, in your face, make you connect to a deeper part of yourself theatre drama...Oh no, the kind that some people always feel the need to bring upon you when you least expect it.  The times when you feel as if you've done nothing wrong and BAM they give you a good sucker-punch to the gut.  Just when you think everything is peaceful and you haven't a care in the world, someone decides to add a little spice to your life and make you feel terrible.  Like it's all your doing--even if it was out of your control and now you're too far away to do anything effective about it....Sometimes I wish that the people I love the most would leave me alone...
xoxo- venting at 2 am is probably not the best idea...

I hate the fact that you thought I hadn't missed you at all since I've been away at school.  Truth be told, you are one of the people I always wished was here.  I know there are no excuses as to why I never called as much as I should have--and I am not going to try to pass the buck and say, " it works both ways."  
      
     Yes, college has been a life changing thing.  Yes, I have met new people and faced new challenges.  This does not erase the friendship and adventures we've shared together.  The life I lead in Orlando is different from the one in Venice--as much as I have fun up here I'm also here to get an education and move on.  I didn't want too many distractions, and as you know, not all distractions are bad ones.  I guess I was scared that we would have a repeat of what happened in October.  The "dark times" were horrible, for both of us, and for some reason I feared that we would sink back into that again since I obviously wasn't able to pay you the kind of attention I though you deserved.

     I'm sorry if I hurt you while I was away.  If you felt left out, or not wanted--that wasn't my intention at all.  I want you to know that you can talk to me whenever about whatever you need to.  Things are going to be easier when I am home---and I promise that next year I will try to be a better friend to you than I was this year.  I was selfish.  I  wanted to focus on life up here whole-heartedly.  I wasn't trying to break ties with you or Venice---I was just ready to move on from somethings and make new ties here. 

Please forgive me,

-P
